did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle:
New York State College of Veterinary Medicine College Clerk Records,
1899-1903

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: New York State College of Veterinary Medicine. College Clerk.

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Account book kept by the College Clerk from 1899-1903. Tracks credits and debits for the College, including salaries, maintenance costs, and department expenses and income.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Charles Ezra Cornell was the College Clerk during this period. He was, in fact, the first to serve in that office, and maintained the position from 1897-1902. He was also the College Librarian, which was then a function of the College Clerk. In addition, because of a requirement in the University Charter, he was a member of the University Board of Trustees as the "eldest lineal descendant of Ezra Cornell."

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Account book kept by the College Clerk from 1899-1903. Tracks credits and debits for the College, including salaries, maintenance costs, and department expenses and income.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Veterinary Medicine.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: New York State College of Veterinary Medicine, College Clerk Records, #24-08-2596. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

acqinfo.head: PROVENANCE
acqinfo.p: Rescued from the trash outside James Law Hall in 1950 by Dr. Howard Evans.
